title: Quality Assurance Analyst 3
description_1: Responsible for examining and analyzing programs, processes, claims, documentation and/or files of unusual, complex and/or higher risk transactions to ensure compliance with internal company requirements and/or agency or government regulations.  Clearly communicates overall process or transaction quality and provides feedback to appropriate contacts regarding identified material deficiencies or issues including identification of inconsistencies.  Analyzes risks and offsets and develops solutions for problems identified.  Acts as mentor to lower level team members and may assist with their development.  Provides support for exam management activities and any other initiatives as needed.

title: Accounts Payable Administrator
description_1: Paying invoices, coding with General Ledger and cost center knowledge. The use of multiple AP and Accounting systems, some 1099 reporting, setting up new vendors and obtaining W-4 documentation.
description_2: SOX compliance, IRS compliance, file retention, journal entries, fixed assets, recurring payment, credit card management, and team member reimbursements.

description_1: Performed general office administrative duties: ordering supplies, maintaining file systems, directing graduate students, maintaining website.
description_2: Events planning, maintaining faculty CVs, and assisting on any faculty projects when needed.

title: Model United Nations
loc: Mesa Community College, Arizona State University
description_1: Researching and presenting policies on a variety of global issues for specific countries. Attending conferences to represent that country as a delegate.
description_2: After participating, I have stayed involved with the MUN organization. I have helped organize entire conferences, I chair committees regularly, and help new students complete their policy assignments.
description_3: I actively still participate in this program as a volunteer, and help train new chairs to runs their committees.

title: Student Public Policy Forum

description_2: In this program, I have worked with policy makers at all levels of government, including making congressional visits in Washington, D.C. I spoke on policy issues surrounding Higher Education in Arizona.
